required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Technetium Based Radioguided Surgery for Prostate Cancer (TRACE) Study
clinical_study.official_title: 99mTechnetium Based PSMA-Radioguided Assisted Surgery for Prostate Cancer (TRACE) Feasibility Study

detailed_description.textblock: Given the difficulty visualizing lymph node involvement with pre-operative imaging alone, and the potential to miss metastatic nodal involvement on template PLND, radioguided surgery has been proposed as a technique to improve intra-operative detection and clearance. 99mTechnetium (99mTc) is a frequently used radioisotope in nuclear medicine, with favourable radiation properties and commercial availability[11]. It has a 6-hour half-life, and is suited to allow target tissue accumulation, while minimizing patients and investigator radiation exposure. Novel molecule-targeted radiopharmaceuticals using 99mTC and other radioisotopes in the setting of PC have increasing potential for diagnostic imaging, monitoring of therapeutic interventions and directed surgery[11, 12]. In relation to radioguided surgery, 99mTC -based PSMA-radioguided surgery (99mTc-PSMA-RGS) was deployed in a feasibility study. Using a specifically designed 99mTc based tracer, 99mTc-mas3-y-nal-k(Sub-KuE), or in short Tc-99m-PSMA I&S, combined with a gamma probe, guidance of the surgical resection of recurrent PC lymph node metastases was undertaken in 132 patients, yielding a sensitivity of 84% and specificity of 100% and detecting metastases as small as 3mm[15, 16]. This raises the question as to whether a combination of PSMA PET/CT imaging and PSMA-radioguided surgery may increase the cure rate in patients undergoing operative management of PC, by increasing detection sensitivity and specificity of nodal metastases.

primary_outcome.measure: sensibility of 99mTc-PSMA Radioguided surgery in lymph node dissection
primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of two days
primary_outcome.description: sensibility of 99mTc-PSMA-I&S by calculating the percentage of PSMA avid lymph nodes

arm_group.description: Tc-99m-PSMA combined with a gamma probe, guidance of the surgical resection of recurrent PC lymph node metastases

study_pop.textblock: men with hormone-sensitive recurent prostate cancer

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male, aged ≥ 18 years.
- Hormone-sensitive recurrent prostate cancer after radical prostatectomy
- <3 soft tissue lesions (lymph node; connective tissue) within the pelvis or retroperitoneum with sufficient PSMA expression (≥3 times regional vascular activity level) as determined by PSMA-based PET
- PSA-value <4ng/mL
- Had a PSMA PET/CT within 60 days before surgery
- Suitable for salvage lymph node dissection, as per institutional guidelines.
- WHO performance status 0,1, or 2.
- Written informed consent.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Suspicion of local recurrent prostate cancer within the prostatic fossa not treatable by surgery
- Nonregional lymphadenopathy (cM1a) or distant metastases (cM1b/c) as assessed by preoperative PSMA PET/CT.
- Ongoing androgen deprivation therapy (ADT) or within 6 months prior to surgery.
- Severe claustrophobia interfering with PET/CT or SPECT/CT scanning.
